column4: Lennar profit beats estimates as home sales  prices rise
column5: Lennar Corp  the second largest U.S. homebuilder  reported a better-than-expected 47 percent jump in quarterly profit as it sold more homes at higher prices  and its shares rose as much as 6 percent in premarket trading.

column4: US STOCKS-Homebuilders climb after Lennar results  NAHB data
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 17 Housing stocks were solidly outperforming the broader market in the early stages of trading on Wednesday  in the wake of earnings from homebuilder Lennar Corp and upbeat data on the housing market.

column5: Sept 17 U.S. homebuilder Lennar Corp  reported a 47 percent rise in quarterly profit as it sold more homes at higher prices  and said orders rose 23 percent.

column4: Boeing-Lockheed venture picks Bezos engine for future rockets
column5: WASHINGTON United Launch Alliance (ULA)  a Boeing Co and Lockheed Martin Corp joint venture  said on Wednesday it would invest heavily in a new rocket engine being developed by Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos and his company Blue Origin.

column4: U.S. Steel hits 3-year high as Canadian unit seeks credit relief
column5: Sept 17 Shares of United States Steel Corp  rose as much 12 percent to a three-year high a day after the company said its loss-making Canadian arm would apply for relief from creditors and that it would drop plans to expand two of its U.S. facilities.

column4: Republicans query U.S. labor board on McDonald's liability view
column5: Sept 17 Two Republican lawmakers on Wednesday asked a U.S. labor agency for more information about a recent finding that fast-food chain McDonald's Corp could be held liable for the labor practices of franchisees  a view that has alarmed many businesses.

column4: USDA grants approval to Dow's Enlist GMO corn and soybeans
column5: Sept 17 The U.S. Department of Agriculture on Wednesday gave final approval to new genetically modified corn and soybeans developed by Dow AgroSciences that  while heavily criticized by environmentalists and some farmers  are portrayed by Dow as an answer to weed resistance problems that limit crop production.

column4: Small ETFs stand to gain in first days after Alibaba IPO
column5: CHICAGO  Sept 17 For a handful of U.S. exchange traded funds  Alibaba's initial public offering has the potential to be a bonanza: they can make the Chinese e-commerce company available to investors in as little as a few days  unlike some of their larger rivals  which may need months.

column4: League and players' union agree on revised drug policy
column5: The National Football League and the union representing its players have agreed to a revised drug policy that includes HGH testing starting this season  the two sides said on Wednesday.

column4: WRAPUP 1-NFL's Vikings say they erred in light Peterson punishment

column4: Parkland Fuel Corp to buy Canada's Pioneer Energy

column4: SE Asia Stocks -Indonesia leads regional gain amid Fed rate speculation
column5: BANGKOK  Sept 17 Southeast Asian stock markets rose cautiously on Wednesday amid speculation the U.S. Federal Reserve would maintain low interest rates  with inflows lifting select Indonesian shares such as Telkom Indonesia  taking the index to a more-than one-week high.     The Fed began its two-day policy meeting on Tuesday.     U.S. stocks ended strongly overnight with participants citing a report in the Wall Street Journal as indicating the Fed could be less hawkish than markets

column4: Sony heads for deeper loss as it shrinks struggling smartphone business
column5: TOKYO Sony Corp cut its earnings outlook for the sixth time on Chief Executive Kazuo Hirai's watch on Tuesday as it announced a massive impairment change on its smartphone unit  which it has failed to grow despite a rapidly expanding market.

column4: Timeline: Sony's recent profit warnings
column5: Japan's Sony Corp forecast a much bigger than expected annual net loss of 230 billion yen ($2.14 billion) as it takes a big impairment charge for its struggling smartphone division. It's the company's sixth guidance cut under CEO Kazuo Hirai  who took the post in April 2012 promising to revive the storied electronics brand by focusing on mobile  gaming and imaging.
